channel.title: Automatically Install
channel.description:
I want to create an application to automatically install some applications
[ol][li]AVG 9.0[/li] [li]Anti-Malwarebytes[/li] [li]SpywareBlaster[/li] [li]Auslogics DiskDefrag[/li] [li]CCleaner[/li] [li]Open Office[/li][/ol]
I want it to be an [b]OFFLINE[/b] installation, Ive had a quick look around the internet and found a program called ninite however this only offers a online installation, which I do not want because of bandwidth usage. I tried to setup a cache server however ninite uses lots of different mirrors for its installation files so it skips the cache server alot of times.
If you could possibly link me to some info on auto-installing some of these programs?

item.title: Automatically Install
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

Most installer scripts can be extracted to find out what registry values they create and where the files are copied to in case that it needs to set up something in %appdata% or your Document folders or copy over DLLs to system32

Solutions:

  1. Pirate portable versions of them.
  2. Use process mon to find out what registry keys and files they use.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

ninite works for offline installations if you purchase a license or some shit. might be able to find something lying around the net for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Automatically Install
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

look for the silent installation command line arguments, like for ccleaner you run ccleaner.exe /S and it will install it with default options without any prompts, as long as the installer itself is an offline installer then you can just put all the commands in a batch file and you will be all set

Read full topic
